meanings.definition: Representing or spelling out the letters of a word in the characters of another alphabet or language.
meanings.sent1: The transliteration of the word 'hello' into Russian characters was challenging.
meanings.sent2: She studied the transliteration of Japanese kanji into English letters.
meanings.sent3: The party game involved a fun challenge of transliterating silly phrases into emoji symbols.
meanings.sent4: In the world of coding, translating code into different programming languages is like a complex transliteration.
meanings.sent5: The art of transliteration can bridge language barriers and connect people from different cultures.

meanings.definition: To change (letters, words, etc.) into corresponding characters of another alphabet or language.
meanings.sent1: He transliterated the ancient text from Greek into modern English for his research.
meanings.sent2: The software can automatically transliterate text from Mandarin to Spanish.
meanings.sent3: The magician's spell seemed to transliterate the words on the page into glowing symbols.
meanings.sent4: Her poetic writing style can transliterate ordinary words into profound expressions.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush seemed to transliterate emotions onto the canvas with each stroke.
